Sudan: Inside besieged El-Obeid, the war's new frontline
subhead: War in Sudan: A Trapped Nation (1/6). For nearly three years, Sudan has been torn apart by a conflict between the national army and the militias of the Rapid Support Forces, leaving some 200,000 people dead. For the first time, Le Monde traveled to El-Obeid, a city threatened by paramilitary forces and now crucial for controlling the country's center.

Eurostar resumes service across Europe after power problem
subhead: A power glitch in the Channel Tunnel caused major disruptions to train services between London, Paris and Amsterdam, prompting the train company to urge passengers to delay travel. Getlink, the tunnel's operator, later said traffic was expected to return to normal overnight.

title: Israel warns it will suspend aid organizations operating in Gaza
subhead: The Ministry of Diaspora Affairs and Combating Antisemitism also accused two Doctors Without Borders employees of links to militant groups and that the latest move is part of Israel's decision to 'strengthen and update' regulations that govern international NGOs in Palestinian territory.

title: UK moves to ban boiling lobsters, shrimp, crabs and langoustines alive, recognizing their capacity for pain
subhead: The measure, to be implemented by 2030, would also apply to crustaceans and cephalopod mollusks, including octopuses, all of which are recognized as sentient beings under British law.

title: Dining at the Centre Pompidou-Metz
subhead: 'A Meal at the Museum' (4/6). Charles Coulombeau, the chef of the brasserie Umé, reinvents French classics with a Japanese twist. His cuisine is as inventive as the museum's art.

Israel: The MAGA world's new obsession
subhead: As Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu is expected to meet with US President Donald Trump in Miami on Monday, December 29, Israel has become a source of contention and fantasy within the Trump movement.

title: Europe's dramatic decline in pharmaceutical production threatens health sovereignty
subhead: The rise of China and India, combined with protectionist pressure from the Trump administration, is redrawing the global map of the pharmaceutical industry. The Europe-wide deindustrialization that began in the 2000s is now accelerating.

title: Dog photographer, a new niche profession: 'The key is to avoid the tongue hanging out'
subhead: Even though the photo galleries of their 'parents' are typically replete with dog photos, a new generation of professional photographers is nonetheless making a living out of artfully crafted canine portraits.
